summary:
Billy Ka is an Egyptian Poet and Heritage Professional who is living in The Netherlands. He finished a Bachelor of Arts, Department of Sociology and Media, at Alexandria University, Egypt in 2010. He obtained a diploma in Media and Literature Translation from the American University in Cairo in 2015. He obtained a Diploma in Project Management from Sean Academy, Ireland, in 2020. He got his first master's degree in Arts, Cultural Policies and Cultural Entrepreneurship from the University of Groningen in the Netherlands in 2022. He got his second degree in Applied Master of Museums and Heritage Studies from Reinwardt Academy (AHK) in Amsterdam in 2023.
He is currently working in the management of artistic and cultural projects. He also has experience in the field of communication and human rights, where he worked for many years as a consultant and media expert in Europe, the Middle East and North Africa. He founded the first youth media initiative in Egypt “Press Action Group” in 2006 by organising media campaigns using street theatre performances and storytelling. In 2015, he continued his passion for art and culture by working with “Mahatat” for contemporary arts in Egypt as a communication specialist and project coordinator. In 2016, he founded the "LIBERALIS" Company which works on the dissemination of visual art in all its forms. In 2020, he founded the LiberActs Association for Arts in France in order to support artists by creating a bridge between Europe and the Middle East and North Africa.

profile_positions.description:
- Provide strategic and executive plan for Liberacts;
- Establish and grow partnerships depending on the project activities with local, national and international stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Deputy Director & Co-Founder

profile_positions.description:
Tasks:
•         Mange the operation team that is responsible of the activities logistics in the field including the allocation and financing the venue and space, accommodation, catering and transportation.
•         Ensure that the activities fieldtrips, scouting, workshop implementation, happens according to LIBERALIS plans and timeline.
•         Follow up to facilitate the work of professional artists in the field including fieldtrips, scouting, and workshop.
•         Coordinate between different stakeholders (Workshop space owner, LIBERALIS  management, Professional artists) to get activities achieved.
•         Monitor and provide primary data for evaluation
•         Submit activities progress and reflective reports to general manger.
•         Attend and participate in reflective and brainstorming team meetings, and staff meeting.
•         Insure activities implementation is within the program/project budget.
•         Follow up with the volunteering committee coordinator to ensure quality implementation of the program/projects.
•         Support and supervise the communication team with data and technical support for online marketing for the program/project.
•         Establish and grow partnership depending on the project activities with local, national and international stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Deputy director_ Co-founder

profile_positions.description:
Job Objective: Ensure the implementation of the PR, Marketing, Media, and
Documentation Strategy.
The key duties involve the following:
 Marketing Mahatat's activities ( social, online, direct, offline), including the
following tasks:
o Put the PR Strategy for Mahatat along with the director, and executing it
according to the relevant action plan
o Follow up and maintain all social media channels.
o Generate networking leads from online and offline communications
o Meet with various stakeholders, introducing and representing Mahatat at
networking events
 Write newsletters, press releases, and blogs about Mahatat’s activities
 Supervise all PR material design, printing and distribution
 Maintain Mahatat’s website updated and feed it with content
 Coordinate with graphic designers, writers, translators, copyeditors,
videographers, illustrators and photographers
 Ensure quality media coverage in Arabic and English
 Supervise the documentation process of all the activities (visual, audio, and
printed)
 Keep the media and journalists database updated 
 Communicate with local, regional and international media.
profile_positions.title: Communications and Community Engagement Officer

company.name: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH

profile_positions.company: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH
profile_positions.description:
1-Networking and Cooperation
-Conceptualize, prepare and implement workshops, trainings, and other events on sexual harassment especially targeting male youth.
-Participate in identifying needs for external support and advice, elaborate on policy recommendations and develop a strategic approach.
-Develop a strong relationship with media in order to ensure high visibility of the project throughout implementation.
-Promote project activities on social media platforms.
-Determine bottleneck and recommend alternative courses of the action to the project manager.
2-Professional Advising and Consulting
-Advise the management of the youth centers in line with the Ministry of Youth and Sport on awareness raising activities for male youth
-Jointly with NP 2 conceptualize and document the activities
-Assist in the selection of trainers and in the implementation of awareness raising sessions
-Advise on effective (social) media and PR
-Provide consultancy on the cooperation with the Ministry of Youth and Sports
3-Knowledge Management
-Monitor and evaluate the effectiveness of the activities
-Prepare reports and presentation materials
-Prepare appropriate input to the various project reports/publications including annual reports, Contribute to other reports required by the Programme Manager and the GIZ Headquarters.
-Documentation of the project activities throughout the project duration.
4-Management and cooperation Tasks
-Coordinate and prioritize relevant activities at the local level in cooperation with the partners, as well as in organizational preparation and in the implementation of these activities (workshops, trainings, seminars, exchange visits, etc.)
-Prepare the budget for key events and activities and related financial documentation according to GIZ financial standards
-Compile relevant information for collaborative activities and missions
profile_positions.title: Youth Development Consultant

profile_positions.company: Deutsche Gesellschaft für Internationale Zusammenarbeit (GIZ) GmbH
profile_positions.description:
-Support of the preparation of the Gender Fair includes, but is not limited to: 
-Organising logistical requirements for successful implementation of Gender Fair 
-Liaising with the contact person at the venue for implementation 
-Making necessary arrangements with venue 
-Organising technical support and getting in touch with our partner Fayoum Agro Organic Development Association whose staff can provide support in this regard 
-Liaising with our partners and providing support they need 
-Organising with our partners directly which resources are needed for the activity 
-Ensuring all required resources are available 
-Collecting and keeping receipts of resources the partners bought for implementation of activity; the invoices should abide by GIZ regulations 
-Coordinating visibility for the event and taking care of advertisement of the event 
 This includes, but is not limited to, disseminating invitations, ensuring brochures and banners are prepared before and available on March 07, disseminating advertisements on various platforms, etc. 
-Coordinating regularly with PDP staff members 

2-Support of the execution of the Gender Fair includes, but is not limited to:
-Executing logistical requirements for successful implementation of Gender Fair 
-Providing general support and coordination for execution of event 
 This includes, but is not limited to, support in registration process, ensure that activities run smoothly and provide logistical support, etc. 
-Arranging and ensuring meeting place(s) are arranged as required 
-Welcoming NGOs and residents, ensuring that tickets are given to NGOs for distribution to residents in order to ensure all participants can enter without any trouble 
-Ensuring visibility is well taken care of during the event 
-If food is provided (t.b.c.), making sure that it is available for participants throughout the day 
-Coordinating and taking care of clean-up of space at the end of the event 
-Other related responsibilities as required
profile_positions.title: Gender Fair Coordinator

profile_positions.description:
•	Social Media

•	Follows up on current topics in regard to women's rights in Egypt and on the regional  level ; documents them to feed them into the discussion between AAW and the public.
•	Daily review on AAWs coverage in media (Internet, Press Etc.) on the national and Arab level and disseminate this into through social media channels + website 
•	Media
•	Liaises with media (Press, TV) as well as networking with journalists and civil rights organizations.
•	Responsible for the marketing and public relations of the AAW.
•	Database 
•	Following up and updating any information in regard to AAW (contacts – publication)

profile_positions.description: •	 A general coordinator for March 15 event which mark the first anniversary of the revolution in Syria  in Cairo institute for human rights studies, it was 2 parts regional through big events in 4 Arab country (Bedna Hurreya we want freedom) “Yemen- Bahrain- Tunisia- Egypt” and the second part through international campaign “short movie for unite for Syria”
profile_positions.title: General Coordinator for March 15 event

profile_positions.description:
-	Establishing the unit of three small committees, one of them work on civil and political rights cases, second one work on social and cultural and economic cases, and the last one it was for environment.
 
-	Daily research about their topic and how it shown in the media 

-	Define the most 3 important cases in every group regarding to our criteria and that's mean that we have 9 topics to make research paper per each on of them.

-	Every committee define one case to make a media campaign for, through the mechanisms of Monitoring & Follow-up and Find_Facts. 

-	Then work on our campaigns with the mechanisms of lobbying and advocacy.
